results.title: Kind Hearts and Coronets
results.creator_credit: Robert Hamer, Sir Michael Balcon and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
A genteel mass-murderer is out to heartlessly eliminate the eight relatives standing between him and the family fortune. Alec Guinness plays all eight victims in this witty black comedy. Based on the novel “Noblesse oblige” by Roy Horniman.

results.title: Preparing for disaster
results.creator_credit: Katie Jennings and KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Fire on the rim”.
People have devised many methods of surviving the upheavals in the “ring of fire”. In Alaska, earthquakes are so extreme, that it is an ideal location for continuous research. In Chile and Hawaii, research focuses on ocean and tidal problems. Japan and New Zealand offer insight into anti-quake designs. In San Francisco, planning, communication, training and organisation have assisted in reducing risk to life and property, as well as preparing for future problems.

results.title: Prediction problem
results.creator_credit: Katie Jennings and KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Fire on the rim”.
Careful planning with technological innovation can minimise the damage and death caused by seismic activity. The education of peoples in lands around the “ring of fire” also assists in avoiding unnecessary disaster. Although scientists can make intelligent guesses about the movement of the earth, the predicition of earthquakes and eruptions remains an imperfect art. The study of historical evidence coupled with intensive research around the Pacific Rim, is helping to gain a clearer picture of the problem.

results.title: Celebrations: birthdays
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “For the juniors”.
A short program aimed at children aged 4-8 discussing the different aspects of preparing for and celebrating a birthday, comparing a traditional birthday party for an Australian child to a German and an Asian child. Also shows how people of all ages celebrate birthdays, and explains just what a birthday is.

results.title: Weather: hot
results.creator_credit: Caroline Jones and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “For the juniors”.
An educational series aimed at 6-8 year olds which covers a variety of subject areas such as weather, transport, space, people and celebrations. When it is hot outside, people wear shorts and t-shirts, drink lots of water, and modify their usual activities to help keep cool. The question is why do we do this? Suitable for children aged 3-7, this video describes how changes in weather affect people, plants and animals differently and the different methods each use to adapt and cope with the heat; what a thermometer is and what it does; how to observe and monitor changes in the weather; and why it is important to dress appropriately when it is hot outside. Also briefly discusses the sun as an energy source.

results.title: Celebrations: achievement
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “For the juniors”.
A short program aimed at children aged 4-8 narrated by Carolyn Jones showing the different ways that people celebrate achieving certain goals. Following a group of year 7 students to their graduation from school, comparing their preparation and celebration to a group of Police Force cadets preparing to graduate from the Academy. Also discussed is the importance of acknowledging all achievements, no matter how small they may seem.

results.title: Flexibility and body composition
results.creator_credit: Steve Henschel, Stephen Netburn and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fit to Be You”.
Explains the relationship of body mass to body fat in maintaining proper body composition and the importance of keeping that well-composed body flexible through the burning of calories. A witty animated sequence shows the interrelationship of individual basal metabolism, calorie intake and the maintenance of a balanced diet.

results.title: Weather: sunshine
results.creator_credit: Janet Lane and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “For the juniors”.
An educational series aimed at 6-8 year olds which covers a variety of subject areas such as weather, transport, space, people and celebrations. This short video describes how the sun creates shadows on the ground and reflections on the water; how as the world rotates, the sun sets on one side of the world and rises on the other; and how people and animals use the sun differently. Suitable for children aged 3-7.
